title: Are gaming laptops good for music production? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes Gaming laptops are good for Music Production, as gaming laptops are designed to handle the work load efficiently and are very effective as compared to other laptops. Gaming laptop have good configuration of RAM, Processor core speed, Fast SSD, etc which can handle your work very easily. If we talk about Music Production, It’s also a quite heavy task. A better Laptop will provide you more room to add your favorite VST plugins or instruments. While choosing a gaming laptop for Music Production always check the single core performance. Music Production depends on the single core of a Processor, so higher the speed of your processor’s single core offers you a quick processing of your sound, where as lower speed of your processor’s single core will increase your processing time of your sound. Audio processing is the most CPU intensive tasks people do on laptops today because it relies on real time processing. That is why music production relies on serial processing instead of parallel processing. It’s always recommended to have a laptop with a higher single core clock speed than having a lower clock speed with more cores. Higher number of cores won’t help you in improving your speed of your DAW or Digital Audio Workstation.

Yes, Gaming laptops are good for music production. In simple words they have good support for the video and audio.

First of all, we have to know the minimum recommended system requirements for music production: Processor: Intel Core i5–8250U RAM: 4GB Storage: 256GB (preferably an SSD over HDD) Most of the gaming laptops have at least have a quad-core processor, 8GB RAM, and over 512GB of storage. Using this data, we can easily conclude that gaming laptops are good for music production. Although, I will not recommend buying a gaming laptop for music production as they are quite heavy and have poor battery life (in most cases). If you are a frequent traveler, this can be a major problem for you. If no, then you can opt for a gaming laptop.

Also, what I have seen is that, even though there are all the components on the board, sound may not be good as the overall heat generated on the board might produce some inductance. I have i7 xeon processor machine with 4GB graphics card, dual cooling system etc.. But before connecting my audio equipment, I just took a recording without connecting anything, it had noticeable sound. External audio equipment is always preferred for music production to minimize latency and inbuilt noise.

Obviously Yes, Gaming Laptops have high performance hardware components (Powerful CPU, SSD and 8~16GB RAM) and all of these are required by any DAW if you're going to produce a professional level track, since your project will contains many heavy synths (like serum) and loads of samples. Powerful CPU helps in handling those heavy synths and fast SSD helps in loading the samples at high speed.
